head.title: Pataki Seeks a Panel On DNA Exonerations

hedline.hl1: Pataki Seeks a Panel On DNA Exonerations

block.p: Gov. George E. Pataki proposed the creation of a state DNA Review Committee that would examine all criminal convictions in New York that were later overturned because of new genetic evidence. The panel would also propose regulations to improve the use of the precise forensic science of DNA profiling by the state's criminal justice system.

Gov. George E. Pataki proposed the creation of a state DNA Review Committee that would examine all criminal convictions in New York that were later overturned because of new genetic evidence. The panel would also propose regulations to improve the use of the precise forensic science of DNA profiling by the state's criminal justice system.
Mr. Pataki said that the committee would work to find the causes of mistaken convictions, and would make proposals to use forensic DNA more thoroughly in future investigations.
